results.title: Buying for immediate use
results.creator_credit: Frieda Dejarnette, Coronet Instructional Films and Spectrum Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
Rates the consumer shopping skills of three young shoppers making typical purchases for immediate use. Illustrates judging quality, price and service and determining which of these factors are valuable in making these purchases. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Bob Graham
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cover to cover”.
Looks at the work of Bob Graham, an Australian author-illustrator. This successful illustrator has a clean, simple style which belies the depth and imagery of his work.

results.title: Clive eats alligators
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cover to cover”.
Trevor Lunn interviews children’s writer Alison Lester about her children’s books particularly “Clive eats alligators”. She dicusses with children from South Melbourne Primary School her reasons and inspirations for writing and the choice of illustrations in her childrens’ books.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch

results.title: Jane Tanner
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner, Victoria. Ministry of Education and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cover to cover”.
Jane Tanner is a Melbourne-based illustrator of children’s books, best known for her illustrations in “Time for a Rhyme” and “There’s a Sea in my Bedroom”. She and Allan Baillie, who writes the text for children’s books, are interviewed by Trevor Lunn. Jane discusses her career, what she thinks makes a good picture book and displays examples of her work as she explains her working methods. She and Allan then discuss collaborating on books.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner, Victoria. Ministry of Education and TV Ed Productions

results.title: The Counselor's day
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Counselling Adolescents”.
Dramatises typical activities of a student counselor in a school program and shows the planning and research which are necessary in understanding the student and his problem. Discusses the background and training of a good counselor; emphasises the value of counseling courses, talks to business and civil groups, professional writing, and teaching experiences in youth organisations and hobby clubs.

results.title: Using analytical tools
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Text-Films and University of Minnesota
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Counselling Adolescents”
Illustrates how a trained student counsellor prepared for his interview with an average 16-year-old boy. Discusses the value of analytical tools - such as the student’s cumularive record, his aptitude tests, his anecdotal record and his auto-biography - in identifying and analysing problems.
